title: v sync off but fps locked at 60
body:
Hi everyone.
So that you know i'm running an hp envy 15 with a i7 2ghz with an integrated intel graphics 4000 and a gtx 850m with 8g ram.
my laptop started bugging because the disk was really full so I manage to do a reset to it.
when I downloaded windows again and install it I downloaded then all my drivers and directx and when I run lol I had a fixed fps at 60. I turned vertical sync off in game with uncapped fps and I disabled it in 3d setting in NVidia control panel and I still got this problem. as soon as the game starts I have the fps incapped for like half a second then it comes back to 60.
when I installed windows and the NVidia drivers updated and I played league without direct x so i had it stuck in 60. because I thought that directx could be the reason I tried to install it but I couldn't. so I rolled back to a previous version of the NVidia driver so that I can install directx and I worked. but again I still had the problem.
I know that it is not important to have it go greater than 60 but I believe that it is not normal and sometimes I have drops of fps to 6 or 10 in game in the middle of teamfights and sometimes without teamfights and I thought that this could be related to the fact that it is stuck on 60.
is it because I installed directx after installing the game ? is it because the game is maybe running with intel instead of NVidia even if it works with NVidia ( I see it in the NVidia activities ).
Thank for all what you can do to help me.

replies.body:
If you reset your PC, it's possible that you automatically enabled the *Game DVR* (part of the Game Bar) feature through windows updates. This feature has caused lock FPS or FPS drops for some players, so I'd recommend disabling the feature entirely using [**this guide**](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html).

Let me know if this helped!
